data: {"type":"data-tool-result","id":"call_function_hlwrdkdghmgc_1","data":{"toolCallId":"call_function_hlwrdkdghmgc_1","result":{"content":"     1â†’# Project Knowledge: Backoffice GM (muatmuat) - Ultra-Deep Analysis
     2â†’
     3â†’## ðŸ“‹ Executive Summary
     4â†’
     5â†’This is an **ultra-comprehensive knowledge base** for the **Backoffice GM** project - a sophisticated micro-frontend system that functions as a specialized financial reconciliation and administration module within the larger muatmuat logistics marketplace ecosystem. This document provides **expert-level understanding** of every architectural decision, business logic flow, and technical pattern used throughout the codebase.
     6â†’
     7â†’### ðŸ¢ Business Context - DEEP INSIGHTS
     8â†’- **Company**: muatmuat (Major Indonesian logistics marketplace platform)
     9â†’- **System Architecture**: **MICRO-FRONTEND** pattern - This is NOT a standalone system but a specialized module within a larger ecosystem
    10â†’- **Primary Users**: Internal finance teams and administrators
    11â†’- **Language**: Full Indonesian localization with proper cultural context
    12â†’- **Market Position**: Enterprise-level B2B logistics platform serving the Indonesian market
    13â†’- **Ecosystem Integration**: Deep integration with main BF_URL backoffice system via SSO
    14â†’
    15â†’### ðŸŽ¯ Core Purpose - BUSINESS LOGIC ANALYSIS
    16â†’1. **Financial Reconciliation**: Critical financial data integrity between marketplace and accounting systems
    17â†’2. **Sequential Processing**: Enforced chronological reconciliation to prevent data corruption
    18â†’3. **Multi-language Management**: Brand and category translations for international operations
    19â†’4. **Specialized Operations**: High-value financial operations requiring specialized interfaces
    20â†’
    21â†’## ðŸš¨ CRITICAL ARCHITECTURAL INSIGHT
    22â†’
    23â†’### **THIS IS NOT A MONOLITHIC APPLICATION**
    24â†’This is a **specialized micro-frontend** that handles specific high-value operations:
    25â†’- **Financial Reconciliation** (primary business value)
    26â†’- **Language Management** for international operations
    27â†’- **Brand/Category Management** for marketplace operations
    28â†’
    29â†’**Most functionality redirects to the main BF_URL system** - this architecture deliberately focuses on core reconciliation workflows while delegating general administrative tasks to the main system.
    30â†’
    31â†’## ðŸ›  Technology Stack
    32â†’
    33â†’### Core Framework
    34â†’- **Next.js 14.2.30** with App Router architecture
    35â†’- **React 18** with client-side components
    36â†’- **JavaScript/JSX** (no TypeScript implementation)
    37â†’
    38â†’### Styling & UI
    39â†’- **SCSS Modules** for component-specific styling
    40â†’- **Tailwind CSS 3.4.1** for utility classes
    41â†’- **Custom color palette** with business-specific themes
    42â†’
    43â†’### State Management & Data Fetching
    44â†’- **Zustand 5.0.0-rc.2** with localStorage persistence
    45â†’- **SWR 2.2.5** for server state management
    46â†’- **Axios 1.7.7** with custom interceptors
    47â†’
    48â†’### Form Handling & UI Components
    49â†’- **React Hook Form 7.53.0** for form management
    50â†’- **React DatePicker 7.4.0** for date inputs
    51â†’- **SweetAlert2 11.6.13** for notifications
    52â†’- **React DnD Kit 6.1.0** for drag and drop functionality
    53â†’
    54â†’## ðŸ— Architecture Overview
    55â†’
    56â†’### Module-Based Architecture
    57â†’The application is structured into two main modules with independent authentication:
    58â†’
    59â†’#### GM Module (General Management)
    60â†’- **Purpose**: Product categorization and administrative functions
    61â†’- **Route Prefix**: `/GM`
    62â†’- **Features**: Brand management, category hierarchy, language settings
    63â†’- **Authentication**: Separate token system (`tokenGM`)
    64â†’
    65â†’#### Finance Module
    66â†’- **Purpose**: Financial reconciliation and reporting
    67â†’- **Route Prefix**: `/finance`
    68â†’- **Features**: Marketplace reconciliation, withdrawal management, financial summaries
    69â†’- **Authentication**: Separate token system (`tokenFinance`)
    70â†’
    71â†’### Authentication Architecture
    72â†’- **Multi-tenant**: Each module has independent authentication
    73â†’- **JWT-based**: Access tokens with refresh token mechanism
    74â†’- **Persistent Storage**: Tokens stored in localStorage via Zustand persistence
    75â†’- **Auto-refresh**: Automatic token refresh with queue management for failed requests
    76â†’
    77â†’## ðŸ“ Project Structure Deep Dive
    78â†’
    79â†’```
    80â†’backoffice-gm/
    81â†’â”œâ”€â”€ src/
    82â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ app/                          # Next.js App Router pages
    83â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ GM/                       # General Management module
    84â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ layout.jsx           # GM module layout
    85â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ page.jsx             # GM home page
    86â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ loading.jsx          # GM loading component
    87â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ master-brand/        # Brand management pages
    88â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ master-grup-kategori/ # Category management pages
    89â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ finance/                  # Finance module
    90â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ layout.jsx           # Finance layout with auth
    91â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ page.jsx             # Finance home page
    92â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ login/               # Finance login
    93â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ rekonsiliasi-marketplace/ # Main reconciliation feature
    94â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ summary/             # Financial summaries
    95â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ components/          # Finance-specific components
    96â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ api/                      # API routes
    97â†’â”‚   â”‚       â””â”€â”€ v1/bo/               # API version 1 backoffice
    98â†’â”‚   â”‚           â””â”€â”€ withdraw/        # Withdrawal endpoints
    99â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/                   # Shared UI components
   100â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Button/                  # Button component with SCSS
   101â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Loading/                 # Global loading overlay
   102â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ModalBO/                 # Modal system
   103â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ DatatableBO/             # Data table component
   104â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Input/                   # Form input components
   105â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ [20+ other components]   # Comprehensive UI library
   106â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ container/                    # Page-level containers
   107â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ HomeContainer/           # Main home container
   108â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ GMContainer/             # GM specific containers
   109â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ [other containers]       # Business logic containers
   110â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ store/                        # Zustand state management
   111â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ zustand/                 # Zustand stores
   112â†’â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ token.js             # Authentication stores (3 modules)
   113â†’â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ loading.js           # Global loading state
   114â†’â”‚   â”‚       â””â”€â”€ [domain stores]      # Business logic stores
   115â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ModalComponents/              # Modal system
   116â†’â”œâ”€â”€ package.json                      # Dependencies and scripts
   117â†’â”œâ”€â”€ next.config.mjs                   # Next.js configuration
   118â†’â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.js               # Tailwind configuration
   119â†’â”œâ”€â”€ jsconfig.json                    # JavaScript path aliases
   120â†’â””â”€â”€ postcss.config.mjs               # PostCSS configuration
   121â†’```
   122â†’
   123â†’## ðŸ” Authentication & Security
   124â†’
   125â†’### Multi-Module Token Management
   126â†’Each module maintains separate authentication stores:
   127â†’
   128â†’```javascript
   129â†’// stores for different modules
   130â†’- useTokenGM (for GM module)
   131â†’- useTokenFinance (for Finance module)
   132â†’- useToken (general purpose)
   133â†’```
   134â†’
   135â†’### Token Storage Pattern
   136â†’```javascript
   137â†’// Zustand with localStorage persistence
   138â†’const useTokenFinance = create(persist(
   139â†’  (set) => ({
   140â†’    accessToken: null,
   141â†’    refreshToken: null,
   142â†’    setTokenFinance: (tokens) => set({
   143â†’      accessToken: tokens.accessToken,
   144â†’      refreshToken: tokens.refreshToken
   145â†’    }),
   146â†’    clearToken: () => {
   147â†’      set({ accessToken: null, refreshToken: null })
   148â†’      localStorage.removeItem('tokenFinance');
   149â†’    }
   150â†’  }),
   151â†’  { name: 'tokenFinance', storage: localStorage }
   152â†’));
   153â†’```
   154â†’
   155â†’### API Client Configuration
   156â†’Axios instance with comprehensive error handling and token refresh:
   157â†’
   158â†’```javascript
   159â†’// Key features:
   160â†’- Automatic token injection
   161â†’- Token refresh with queue management
   162â†’- 503 maintenance page redirect
   163â†’- 401/403 handling with logout
   164â†’- 30-second timeout configuration
   165â†’```
   166â†’
   167â†’## ðŸŽ¨ UI Component System
   168â†’
   169â†’### Styling Architecture
   170â†’1. **SCSS Modules**: Component-specific scoped styling
   171â†’2. **Tailwind CSS**: Utility classes for rapid development
   172â†’3. **Custom Design System**: Business-specific color palette
   173â†’
   174â†’### Color System (Business Context)
   175â†’```scss
   176â†’// Business-specific colors from Tailwind config
   177â†’primary: #008fff (blue)           // Primary actions
   178â†’secondary: #ffc117 (yellow)       // Secondary elements
   179â†’success: #00af6c (green)          // Success states
   180â†’warning: #fee61a (yellow)         // Warning states
   181â†’error: #f22c25 (red)              // Error states
   182â†’
   183â†’// Business domain colors
   184â†’"buyer-seller": #325abb (blue)    // Buyer/seller interactions
   185â†’"muat-parts-member": #b02316 (red)    // Member parts
   186â†’"muat-parts-non": #ef4422 (orange)    // Non-member parts
   187â†’"muat-trans": #8f8f87 (gray)     // Transaction parts
   188â†’"blue-sidebar": #002064 (dark blue)   // Sidebar
   189â†’"green-sync": #27CF23 (bright green)  // Sync status
   190â†’```
   191â†’
   192â†’### Component Library Pattern
   193â†’All components follow this structure:
   194â†’```
   195â†’ComponentName/
   196â†’â”œâ”€â”€ index.jsx           # Main component
   197â†’â””â”€â”€ ComponentName.module.scss  # Scoped styles
   198â†’```
   199â†’
   200â†’## ðŸ“Š State Management Patterns
   201â†’
   202â†’### Zustand Store Architecture
   203â†’```javascript
   204â†’// Pattern for all stores
   205â†’import { create } from "zustand";
   206â†’import { persist } from "zustand/middleware";
   207â†’
   208â†’const useStoreName = create(persist(
   209â†’  (set) => ({
   210â†’    // state properties
   211â†’    data: null,
   212â†’    loading: false,
   213â†’
   214â†’    // actions
   215â†’    setData: (data) => set({ data }),
   216â†’    setLoading: (loading) => set({ loading }),
   217â†’  }),
   218â†’  { name: 'storeKey', storage: localStorage }
   219â†’));
   220â†’```
   221â†’
   222â†’### SWR Data Fetching Pattern
   223â†’```javascript
   224â†’// Custom hooks for API calls
   225â†’import { useSWRHook, useSWRMutateHook } from "@/app/finance/utils/useSWRHook";
   226â†’
   227â†’// GET requests
   228â†’const { data, error, isLoading } = useSWRHook('/api/endpoint');
   229â†’
   230â†’// Mutations (POST/PUT/DELETE)
   231â†’const { trigger, isMutating } = useSWRMutateHook('/api/endpoint', 'POST');
   232â†’```
   233â†’
   234â†’## ðŸ”€ Routing Architecture
   235â†’
   236â†’### App Router Structure
   237â†’Next.js 14 App Router with the following patterns:
   238â†’
   239â†’#### GM Module Routes
   240â†’```
   241â†’/GM                           # Home page
   242â†’/GM/setting-bahasa           # Language settings
   243â†’/GM/master-brand              # Brand management
   244â†’/GM/master-brand/form         # Brand creation/editing
   245â†’/GM/master-grup-kategori      # Category management
   246â†’/GM/master-grup-kategori/kategori      # Categories
   247â†’/GM/master-grup-kategori/sub-kategori  # Sub-categories
   248â†’```
   249â†’
   250â†’#### Finance Module Routes
   251â†’```
   252â†’/finance                              # Finance home
   253â†’/finance/login                        # Finance login
   254â†’/finance/rekonsiliasi-marketplace     # Main reconciliation
   255â†’/finance/rekonsiliasi-marketplace/[date] # Date-specific view
   256â†’/finance/summary/marketplace          # Marketplace summaries
   257â†’```
   258â†’
   259â†’### Layout Pattern
   260â†’Each module has its own layout:
   261â†’- **GM Layout**: Simple wrapper without authentication
   262â†’- **Finance Layout**: Full layout with sidebar, navbar, and authentication guards
   263â†’
   264â†’## ðŸ“… Core Business Logic: Reconciliation System
   265â†’
   266â†’### Calendar-Based Reconciliation
   267â†’The core feature is a sophisticated calendar system for tracking data synchronization between marketplace and internal systems.
   268â†’
   269â†’### Key Components
   270â†’1. **MonthCalendar**: Displays calendar grid for monthly reconciliation
   271â†’2. **CalendarCell**: Individual date cells with sync status
   272â†’3. **Date Utils**: Utilities for date calculations and sync status
   273â†’
   274â†’### Sync Status Logic
   275â†’```javascript
   276â†’// From dateUtils.js - core reconciliation logic
   277â†’const hasSyncIssue = (day) => {
   278â†’  const invoiceIssue = day.invoiceSyncStatus && day.invoiceSyncStatus !== "OK";
   279â†’  const paymentIssue = day.paymentSyncStatus && day.paymentSyncStatus !== "OK";
   280â†’  const combinedIssue = day.syncStatus && day.syncStatus !== "OK";
   281â†’
   282â†’  return invoiceIssue || paymentIssue || combinedIssue;
   283â†’};
   284â†’
   285â†’// Find earliest unreconciled date
   286â†’export const findEarliestUnreconciledDate = (allData) => {
   287â†’  const today = new Date();
   288â†’  today.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0);
   289â†’
   290â†’  const filtered = allData
   291â†’    ?.filter((d) => {
   292â†’      const date = new Date(d.date);
   293â†’      return date < today && hasSyncIssue(d);
   294â†’    })
   295â†’    .sort((a, b) => new Date(a.date) - new Date(b.date));
   296â†’
   297â†’  return filtered.length > 0 ? new Date(filtered[0].date) : null;
   298â†’};
   299â†’```
   300â†’
   301â†’### Indonesian Localization
   302â†’All user-facing text uses Indonesian language:
   303â†’```javascript
   304â†’// Day names in Indonesian
   305â†’const dayNames = [
   306â†’  "MINGGU", "SENIN", "SELASA", "RABU",
   307â†’  "KAMIS", "JUMAT", "SABTU"
   308â†’];
   309â†’
   310â†’// Month names in Indonesian
   311â†’const monthMap = {
   312â†’  Januari: 1, Februari: 2, Maret: 3, April: 4,
   313â†’  Mei: 5, Juni: 6, Juli: 7, Agustus: 8,
   314â†’  September: 9, Oktober: 10, November: 11, Desember: 12
   315â†’};
   316â†’```
   317â†’
   318â†’## ðŸ›  Development Guidelines
   319â†’
   320â†’### File Naming Conventions
   321â†’- **Components**: PascalCase (e.g., `Button.jsx`, `ModalBO.jsx`)
   322â†’- **SCSS Files**: ComponentName.module.scss (e.g., `Button.module.scss`)
   323â†’- **Stores**: camelCase (e.g., `token.js`, `loading.js`)
   324â†’- **API Routes**: RESTful patterns with `route.js` files
   325â†’
   326â†’### Import/Export Patterns
   327â†’```javascript
   328â†’// Path aliases configured in jsconfig.json
   329â†’import Component from "@/components/ComponentName";
   330â†’import { useStore } from "@/store/zustand/storeName";
   331â†’import api from "@/app/finance/utils/api";
   332â†’```
   333â†’
   334â†’### Component Structure Pattern
   335â†’```jsx
   336â†’// Standard component pattern
   337â†’'use client'; // Required for client-side components
   338â†’
   339â†’import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   340â†’import styles from './ComponentName.module.scss';
   341â†’
   342â†’const ComponentName = ({ prop1, prop2 }) => {
   343â†’  // State and effects
   344â†’
   345â†’  return (
   346â†’    <div className={styles.container}>
   347â†’      {/* Component JSX */}
   348â†’    </div>
   349â†’  );
   350â†’};
   351â†’
   352â†’export default ComponentName;
   353â†’```
   354â†’
   355â†’## ðŸ”§ Common Development Tasks
   356â†’
   357â†’### Adding New Pages
   358â†’1. Create `page.jsx` in appropriate directory under `src/app/`
   359â†’2. Follow existing patterns for client components (`'use client';`)
   360â†’3. Use existing layout components or create new ones
   361â†’4. Add navigation to sidebar menu if needed
   362â†’
   363â†’### Creating API Endpoints
   364â†’1. Create `route.js` in `src/app/api/v1/bo/[module]/[endpoint]/`
   365â†’2. Export HTTP method functions (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
   366â†’3. Follow existing error handling patterns
   367â†’4. Use NextResponse for responses
   368â†’
   369â†’### Building Forms
   370â†’1. Use React Hook Form for form management
   371â†’2. Leverage existing input components
   372â†’3. Follow validation patterns from existing forms
   373â†’4. Use SCSS modules for styling
   374â†’
   375â†’### Implementing Authentication
   376â†’1. Use appropriate token store for module (GM/Finance)
   377â†’2. Wrap protected routes in layout with authentication checks
   378â†’3. Handle token refresh and logout scenarios
   379â†’4. Follow existing redirect patterns
   380â†’

   407â†’## ðŸ§ª Testing & Quality

   442â†’## ðŸš€ Recent Development Activity

   444â†’### Recent Commit Patterns (from git history)

   457â†’## ðŸ’¡ Best Practices for This Codebase
   458â†’
   459â†’### DO's
   460â†’- Use existing component library before creating new components

   475â†’## ðŸ” Debugging & Troubleshooting
   476â†’
   477â†’### Common Issues

   480â†’3. **Styling issues**: Check SCSS module imports and Tailwind configuration
   481â†’4. **Build failures**: Usually related to ESLint (currently ignored)

   489â†’## ðŸ“š Additional Resources

   497â†’### Component Dependencies

   503â†’## ðŸ”¬ ULTRA-DEEP SYSTEM ANALYSIS
   504â†’
   505â†’### ðŸŒ **MICRO-FRONTEND ECOSYSTEM ARCHITECTURE**
   506â†’
   507â†’#### **External System Integration Map**
   508â†’This system operates within a complex ecosystem:
   509â†’
   510â†’```
   511â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    SSO Integration    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   512â†’â”‚   BF_URL Main   â”‚ â—„â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â–º â”‚ Backoffice GM    â”‚
   513â†’â”‚   Backoffice    â”‚    URL Parameters     â”‚ (This System)    â”‚
   514â†’â”‚   System         â”‚                      â”‚                  â”‚
   515â†’â”‚                 â”‚                      â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
   516â†’â”‚ - User Managementâ”‚                      â”‚ â”‚ Finance Module  â”‚ â”‚
   517â†’â”‚ - General Admin  â”‚                      â”‚ â”‚ - Reconciliation â”‚ â”‚
   518â†’â”‚ - Reporting      â”‚                      â”‚ â”‚ - Withdrawals   â”‚ â”‚
   519â†’â”‚ - Settings       â”‚                      â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
   520â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜                      â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
   521â†’                                          â”‚ â”‚ GM Module       â”‚ â”‚
   522â†’                                          â”‚ â”‚ - Categories    â”‚ â”‚
   523â†’                                          â”‚ â”‚ - Brands        â”‚ â”‚
   524â†’                                          â”‚ â”‚ - Languages     â”‚ â”‚
   525â†’                                          â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
   526â†’                                          â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   527â†’```
   528â†’
   529â†’#### **Multi-API Architecture**
   530â†’- **NEXT_PUBLIC_GLOBAL_API**: Main API for most operations
   531â†’- **NEXT_PUBLIC_GLOBAL_API_MUATPARTS**: Specialized API for muatparts operations
   532â†’- **NEXT_PUBLIC_BF_URL**: External backoffice system (redirects most functionality)
   533â†’- **NEXT_PUBLIC_INTERNAL_WEB**: Internal system for maintenance redirects
   534â†’
   535â†’### ðŸ” **COMPLEX AUTHENTICATION FLOW**
   536â†’
   537â†’#### **Triple-Layer Authentication Pattern**
   538â†’```javascript
   539â†’// Authentication Flow Architecture
   540â†’MainApp (URL parameter auth)
   541â†’    â†“
   542â†’ClientApp (Module-specific guards)
   543â†’    â†“
   544â†’Module Layouts (Layout auth)
   545â†’    â†“
   546â†’API Layer (Token validation)
   547â†’```
   548â†’
   549â†’#### **URL Parameter SSO System**
   550â†’```javascript
   551â†’// Auto-login via URL parameters
   552â†’const urlParams = param.get('url');
   553â†’const emailParams = param.get('email');
   554â†’const tokenParams = param.get('token');
   555â†’
   556â†’// Automatic authentication and redirect
   557â†’login(emailParams, tokenParams, (response) => {
   558â†’  if(response.status == 200){
   559â†’    setToken({
   560â†’      accessToken: response.data.Data.accessToken,
   561â†’      refreshToken: response.data.Data.refreshToken
   562â†’    })
   563â†’    router.push(`/${urlParams}`)
   564â†’  }
   565â†’})
   566â†’```
   567â†’
   568â†’### ðŸ“Š **SOPHISTICATED RECONCILIATION BUSINESS LOGIC**
   569â†’
   570â†’#### **Sequential Processing Engine**
   571â†’The reconciliation system enforces strict chronological processing:
   572â†’
   573â†’```javascript
   574â†’// Business Rule: Cannot access dates after earliest unreconciled date
   575â†’const handleClick = () => {
   576â†’  if (!cellDate || isFutureOrToday) return;
   577â†’
   578â†’  // Guard access to dates after the earliest unreconciled date
   579â†’  if (earliestUnreconciledDate && cellDate > earliestUnreconciledDate) {
   580â†’    // Show modal with the earliest unreconciled date
   581â†’    dateNotOk(formatted);
   582â†’  } else {
   583â†’    // Navigate directly if clicking the earliest unreconciled date
   584â†’    router.push(`/finance/rekonsiliasi-marketplace/${cell.data.date}`);
   585â†’  }
   586â†’};
   587â†’```
   588â†’
   589â†’#### **Status Progression Matrix**
   590â†’**Invoice Status Flow:**
   591â†’```
   592â†’Not Started â†’ Not Sync â†’ OK
   593â†’```
   594â†’
   595â†’**Payment Status Flow:**
   596â†’```
   597â†’Not Imported â†’ Not OK â†’ Not Sync â†’ OK
   598â†’```
   599â†’
   600â†’#### **Error Recovery System**
   601â†’Each error type has specific recovery actions:
   602â†’```javascript
   603â†’const errorMessages = {
   604â†’  invoice_not_sync_before_periode: "Invoice belum sinkronisasi. Sinkronisasi invoice terlebih dahulu",
   605â†’  not_recon: "Terdapat data yang belum direkonsiliasi. Pastikan semua data yang akan disinkronisasi sudah direkonsiliasi",
   606â†’  payment_not_sync: "Terdapat data yang belum direkonsiliasi. Pastikan semua data yang akan disinkronisasi sudah direkonsiliasi",
   607â†’  gagal_invoice_sync: "Sinkronisasi Invoice gagal. Periksa terlebih dahulu atau sinkronisasi ulang",
   608â†’  gagal_payment_sync: "Sinkronisasi Payment gagal. Periksa terlebih dahulu atau Sinkronisasi ulang"
   609â†’};
   610â†’```
   611â†’
   612â†’### ðŸŽ¨ **ADVANCED UI/UX PATTERNS**
   613â†’
   614â†’#### **Visual Communication System**
   615â†’- **Emoji-based Status Icons**: âŒ (issues), ðŸ”„ (in progress), âœ… (success), âš ï¸ (warning), â“ (unknown)
   616â†’- **Color Psychology**: Red for errors, green for success, gray for in-progress
   617â†’- **Indonesian Date Formatting**: Full cultural localization with proper timezone handling
   618â†’- **Tooltip-rich Interface**: Detailed status information on hover
   619â†’
   620â†’#### **Modal Architecture Pattern**
   621â†’```javascript
   622â†’// Global Modal Provider with flexible configuration
   623â†’const [getModal, setModal] = useState({
   624â†’  modalId: "",
   625â†’  isLoading: false,
   626â†’  withHeader: true,
   627â†’  closeArea: true,
   628â†’  hideCloseButton: false,
   629â†’  sizeHeader: 'small',
   630â†’  props: null
   631â†’});
   632â†’```
   633â†’
   634â†’### âš¡ **PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION STRATEGIES**
   635â†’
   636â†’#### **React Performance Patterns**
   637â†’- **useMemo**: Expensive calendar calculations and date computations
   638â†’- **useCallback**: Function reference optimization
   639â†’- **useTransition**: Non-blocking localStorage operations
   640â†’- **Client-Side Pagination**: Array slicing for large datasets
   641â†’
   642â†’#### **State Management Optimizations**
   643â†’- **Zustand Lightweight State**: Minimal memory footprint
   644â†’- **LocalStorage Persistence**: Cross-session state maintenance
   645â†’- **Selective Store Updates**: Prevents unnecessary re-renders
   646â†’- **Debounced Search**: Performance optimization for search functionality
   647â†’
   648â†’### ðŸ›¡ï¸ **ENTERPRISE-LEVEL ERROR HANDLING**
   649â†’
   650â†’#### **Token Refresh Queue System**
   651â†’```javascript
   652â†’// Prevents multiple simultaneous refresh attempts
   653â†’let isRefreshing = false;
   654â†’let failedQueue = [];
   655â†’
   656â†’const processQueue = (error, token) => {
   657â†’  failedQueue.forEach((prom) => {
   658â†’    if (error) prom.reject(error);
   659â†’    else prom.resolve(token);
   660â†’  });
   661â†’  failedQueue = [];
   662â†’};
   663â†’```
   664â†’
   665â†’#### **Comprehensive Error Recovery**
   666â†’- **503 Maintenance Redirect**: Automatic redirect to maintenance page
   667â†’- **401/403 Handling**: Token refresh followed by graceful logout
   668â†’- **Network Error Recovery**: Retry mechanisms and user feedback
   669â†’- **Form Validation Protection**: Unsaved changes warnings
   670â†’
   671â†’### ðŸ—‚ï¸ **ADVANCED STATE MANAGEMENT PATTERNS**
   672â†’
   673â†’#### **Pagination Store Analysis**
   674â†’```javascript
   675â†’// Sophisticated client-side pagination with search integration
   676â†’const localPaginationStore = create((set) => ({
   677â†’  data: [],
   678â†’  search: '',
   679â†’  dataPagination: [],
   680â†’  offset: 10,
   681â†’  currentPage: 1,
   682â†’  totalPages: 0,
   683â†’
   684â†’  // Dynamic data slicing with search filtering
   685â†’  setSearch: val => set((state) => {
   686â†’    let result = state.data?.filter(b =>
   687â†’      b.Locale.toLowerCase().includes(val.toLowerCase()) ||
   688â†’      b.LanguageName.toLowerCase().includes(val.toLowerCase())
   689â†’    ).slice(0, (state.currentPage-1) + state.offset);
   690â†’    return { dataPagination: result, search: val };
   691â†’  })
   692â†’}));
   693â†’```
   694â†’
   695â†’### ðŸ”§ **DEVELOPMENT PATTERNS & BEST PRACTICES**
   696â†’
   697â†’#### **Component Architecture Patterns**
   698â†’- **Container Pattern**: Business logic separated from presentation
   699â†’- **Higher-Order Components**: Cross-cutting concerns (auth, loading)
   700â†’- **Composition over Inheritance**: Flexible component composition
   701â†’- **Prop Drilling Minimization**: Strategic context usage
   702â†’
   703â†’#### **Code Organization Principles**
   704â†’- **Feature-Based Structure**: Components grouped by business feature
   705â†’- **Shared Component Library**: Reusable UI components
   706â†’- **Service Layer**: API communication abstraction
   707â†’- **Utility Functions**: Business logic separation
   708â†’
   709â†’### ðŸš€ **DEPLOYMENT & OPERATIONAL INSIGHTS**
   710â†’
   711â†’#### **Environment Configuration**
   712â†’```javascript
   713â†’// Multi-environment API configuration
   714â†’const environments = {
   715â†’  development: {
   716â†’    NEXT_PUBLIC_GLOBAL_API: 'https://dev-api.muatmuat.com',
   717â†’    NEXT_PUBLIC_BF_URL: 'https://dev-backoffice.muatmuat.com',
   718â†’    NEXT_PUBLIC_INTERNAL_WEB: 'https://dev-internal.muatmuat.com'
   719â†’  },
   720â†’  production: {
   721â†’    NEXT_PUBLIC_GLOBAL_API: 'https://api.muatmuat.com',
   722â†’    NEXT_PUBLIC_BF_URL: 'https://backoffice.muatmuat.com',
   723â†’    NEXT_PUBLIC_INTERNAL_WEB: 'https://internal.muatmuat.com'
   724â†’  }
   725â†’};
   726â†’```
   727â†’
   728â†’#### **Build Optimization**
   729â†’- **Code Splitting**: Route-based and component-based splitting
   730â†’- **Font Optimization**: Local font loading with Avenir Next LT Pro
   731â†’- **Image Optimization**: Next.js Image component with lazy loading
   732â†’- **Bundle Analysis**: Regular bundle size monitoring
   733â†’
   734â†’### ðŸŽ¯ **CRITICAL SUCCESS FACTORS**
   735â†’
   736â†’#### **Business Logic Integrity**
   737â†’1. **Sequential Processing**: Prevents data corruption through enforced order
   738â†’2. **Dependency Management**: Invoice sync required before payment sync
   739â†’3. **Audit Trail**: Complete logging of all reconciliation activities
   740â†’4. **Rollback Capability**: Ability to reverse failed operations
   741â†’
   742â†’#### **User Experience Excellence**
   743â†’1. **Visual Feedback**: Clear status indicators at every step
   744â†’2. **Guided Workflows**: Step-by-step reconciliation process
   745â†’3. **Error Recovery**: Automated recovery with user guidance
   746â†’4. **Performance**: Fast response times for financial operations
   747â†’
   748â†’#### **System Reliability**
   749â†’1. **Graceful Degradation**: System remains functional during partial failures
   750â†’2. **Data Consistency**: Strong consistency guarantees across systems
   751â†’3. **Security**: Comprehensive authentication and authorization
   752â†’4. **Scalability**: Handles growing transaction volumes
   753â†’
   754â†’---
   755â†’
   756â†’*This ultra-comprehensive knowledge base provides expert-level understanding of the backoffice-gm system. This system serves as a critical financial operations hub within the larger muatmuat logistics ecosystem.*","metadata":{"truncated":false,"lineCount":756,"filePath":"CLAUDE.md","preview":false}}}}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":"## Project Overview: Backoffice GM (muatmuat)

This is a **sophisticated micro-"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":"frontend system** that functions as a specialized financial reconciliation and administration module within the larger **muatmuat** logistics marketplace ecosystem (a major Indonesian logistics platform).

###"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" ðŸ¢ Business Context
- **Company**: muatmuat (Indonesian logistics marketplace)
- **Primary Users**: Internal finance teams and administrators
- **Architecture**: Micro-frontend pattern integrated"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" with the main BF_URL backoffice system

### ðŸ“± Core Modules

| Module | Route | Purpose |
|--------|-------|---------|
| **GM Module** | `/GM`"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" | Product categorization, brand management, category hierarchy, language settings |
| **Finance Module** | `/finance` | Financial reconciliation, withdrawal management, marketplace summaries |

###"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" ðŸ›  Technology Stack

- **Framework**: Next.js 14.2.30 with App Router
- **UI**: React 18, Tailwind CSS 3.4."}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":"1, SCSS Modules
- **State Management**: Zustand 5.0.0-rc.2, SWR 2.2.5
- **Forms**: React Hook Form"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" 7.53.0
- **HTTP**: Axios 1.7.7
- **Styling**: Custom business-specific color palette

### ðŸŽ¯ Core Business"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" Features

1. **Financial Reconciliation** - Calendar-based system for tracking marketplace-to-accounting data sync
2. **Sequential Processing** -"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" Enforced chronological reconciliation to prevent data corruption
3. **Multi-language Management** - Brand/category translations for international operations
4. **Withdrawal Management** - Financial operations handling"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":"

### ðŸ” Authentication

- Multi-tenant architecture with separate token systems for GM (`tokenGM`) and Finance (`tokenFinance`)
- JWT-based"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" with refresh token mechanism
- LocalStorage persistence via Zustand

src/

### ðŸ“¦ Monorepo Setup

Uses **Turborepo**"}

data: {"type":"text-delta","id":"019c909e-60ed-75ee-b488-6441bc150206","delta":" with npm workspaces. Additional packages from `@muatmuat/*` are shared across the monorepo.

"}
